person.persName: Allen Hurst (Union County, Tennessee, circuit court clerk, farmer, and politician)

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, circuit court clerk, farmer, and politician. Tazewell County, Virginia, native. Son of John Hurst and Elizabeth Thompson Hurst. Married to Lavina Hurst. Father of Findley Hurst, Arminta Hurst, Milton Hurst, Elbert Hurst, Elizabeth Hurst, and Napoleon Hurst. Farmer in Grainger County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Grainger County in 1850. Employed Jemima Blackburn as a domestic servant in Grainger County in 1850. Employed William Horden, William Blansett, Newton Filoy, James Howell, and John Wilson as laborers in Grainger County in 1850. Clerk for the Union County Circuit Court in 1859. Member of the Tennessee State Senate from Union County in 1859. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Member of the Tennessee State General Assembly from Anderson, Campbell, Claiborne, and Grainger Counties from 1859 to 1863.
